Text: RE Japanese TranslationVince Thanks for keeping up with this one Mike Original Message From Kaminski Vince J Sent Thursday October PM To Grimes Michael Cc Hirl Joseph Subject RE Japanese Translation Mike I have received a msg from RISK The contract has beed signed with a local publisher in Japan They dont have a firm date for publication yet but promised to get back to me soon Vince Original Message From Grimes Michael Sent Thursday October PM To Kaminski Vince J Cc Watanabe Mika Subject RE Japanese Translation Vince Thanks much Im just trying to work this into our PR plans Mike Original Message From Kaminski Vince J Sent Thursday October PM To Grimes Michael Cc Kaminski Vince J Subject RE Japanese Translation Mike I sent an inquiry to RISK The problem is that they lost people in the terrorist attack on WTC and the names havent been released The chances are I sent a message to a person who is swamped with work or will not respond at all We have to wait a few days Vince Original Message From Grimes Michael Sent Wednesday October AM To Kaminski Vince J Subject Japanese Translation Vince Joe Hirl mentioned this morning that the risk book that Enron wrote will be published in Japanese in the near future Can you tell me who would kinow the publication details so that we can try to use it in suport of our publicity efforts for Enron in Japan Thanks Mike

Correction Japan Working Group Minutesdisregard my previous note This one has the minutes from todays meeting attached Ill forward the Singapore presentation and the Japan gas comments in the near future Please let me know if there is anything youd like to add to the agenda for the next meeting Mike

Minutes of Japan Working Group Meeting are the minutes of the last conference call along with two items on transmission congestion pricing the presentation Dan Allegretti briefed us on and a list of questions and answers about flowgate transmission pricing for background Please send me any agenda items youd like to cover in the next meeting by Monday Oct Mike

Japans Upper House Election Cc nicholaso Steve Attached is the latest projection of LDPs success in the upper house elections to be held July th As indicated although the LDP will likely retain control due to Koizumis continuing popularity the real test of restructuring resolve will start after the election Mike

FW Translation Nikkei Business Cc Rick Fairly balanced reporting by the Nikkei FYI Mike Original Message From Fitzgibbon Tom Sent Friday November PM To Grimes Michael ODay Nicholas Imai Makiko Anai Rousseau Watanabe Mika Pettersen Morten E Hirl Joseph Niesler Stefan Higaki Akiko Fitzgibbon Tom skean Palmer Mark A PR Meyer Vance Denne Karen Schmidt Ann M Gentle Jackie Thirsk Jeremy Nath Tani Crowther Mark McBride Jane Hughes Llewelyn Kamihaba Kenji Subject Translation Nikkei Business Please find attached translation of a short article from Nikkei Business dated November

TXU ContactRick Sorry to bug you during such a stressful time and I appreciate the time you spent with me last week However my short term memory failed and I dont recall the name you mentioned at TXU When you get a spare minute could you remind me what it is Thanks Mike

RE TXU ContactThanks Rick Original Message From Shapiro Richard Sent Tuesday November PM To Grimes Michael Subject RE TXU Contact Chad Small Original Message From Grimes Michael Sent Mon PM To Shapiro Richard Cc Subject TXU Contact Rick Sorry to bug you during such a stressful time and I appreciate the time you spent with me last week However my short term memory failed and I dont recall the name you mentioned at TXU When you get a spare minute could you remind me what it is Thanks Mike

FW Email from Enron HoustonRick Heres the message from Joe FYI Mike Original Message From Hirl Joseph Sent Tuesday November PM To DLTok Enron Japan Subject Email from Enron Houston Everyone here recently received an email from the Office of the Chairman indicating that reductions in businesses will happen from next week Our situation here in Japan is precisely how Nick and I outlined during our floor meeting Monday morning This was further confirmed in a conversation I had with Mike McConnell this morning As discussed we are currently looking for outside investors to support Enrons businesses in Japan We will keep you abreast of our progress Joe

Enron Japan Public Affairs Support Cc Rick Prior to our call tomorrow morning attached are slides prepared by Mark and me in response to Joe Hirls request for a proposal on how to address the issues facing Enron in this region Well discuss these with him before noon tomorrow Mike

APEC Energy Working Group Leaning toward Energy Security and Oil Cc nicholasoRick Attached for reference are two documents circulated by the APEC Energy Working Group in the runup to the APEC leaders meeting in Shanghai The first a draft report on the Implementation of Energy Initiatives pays lip service to member economies progress toward the goals of enacting principles that support competitive energy markets The second outlines the efforts EWG plans to take to enhance energy security in the region Although nothing happens quickly with this group the plan focuses on measures to ensure the flow of oil in the region Short term issues include increasing the availability of oil trade data reevaluating oil stock piles and examining sea lane security EWGs concrete plans for dealing with these are to schedule some meetings over the next year Ill continue to monitor this kind of information as it appears for action that could affect Enrons business Mike

Regulatory Support in the AsiaPacific Region Cc Rick For reference during our phone call I attach the slides Mark I used in our discussions with Joe Hirl Joes preference is that the costs in the budget I forwarded separately should be split between Enron Japan which reports to Mike McConnell and EPower which belongs to John Sherriff Accordingly the last slide in the presentation is intended to show how Mark and I will coordinate our experience on a case by case basis to address to support both operations The rest of the slides give a summary of the AP environment In addition to the budget and the general plan for support out here Id like to raise the following issues Personnel in the region Plans for maintaining contact with regulatory personnel in Houston Talk to you in the morningevening Mike

RE your callThanks Rick I really appreciate the time and effort you have spent keeping everyone informed and Ill try to catch up with you in person next Monday or Tuesday instead of bugging you on the phone now Unfortunately Ill be in the air during your next scheduled call Your news is not surprising and we probably cant expect any firm direction until some bigger decisions are taken There hasnt been any information available here about whether Japan is core either In the mean time EPower is taking a lot of Marks time as they try to figure out how to move their generating plant projects forward The EGM activity has slowed down considerably and Project Sato is stalled until they hear a good explanation so we are also focusing on the now developing Japanese emissions policy and finalizing some work for EIMForest Products Mike Original Message From Shapiro Richard Sent Thursday November AM To Grimes Michael Subject your call Very little clarity from Ken Randolph and probably wont come for some timenot good from the perspective of planning or certainty I can expand upon if you wish to call Thanks

Physical Delivery of Forest Products in Japan Cc Om Attached is a summary of the challenges to physically delivering forest products in Japan Briefly its a cumbersome process complicated by the interrelationship between industry government and quasigovernment entities like most things in Japan In short it would be possible but time consuming for Enron to manage physical deliveries in Japan Let me know if you would like any more work on this issue and I hope well be in touch before long Mike
